sense.name: the time interval between the deposit of a bank check and its payment
sense.examples: There is a three-day float on personal checks deposited at this bank. The banks earned interest on the checks during their float period.

sense.name: amount of shares available for trading at a given time
sense.examples: A deeply liquid market has a much greater float than a small, illiquid one. What is the average float on Wall Street on a given day?

sense.name: an ice cream soda drink
sense.examples: Mary ordered a hamburger and a root beer float. He put two scoops of ice cream in each float.

sense.name: a decorative display for a parade, mounted on a platform
sense.examples: The beauty queen will ride the first float in the Thanksgiving Day parade. The students worked all night to finish adding the decorations and flowers to their float.

sense.name: hand tool for smoothing plaster
sense.examples: John used a float to smooth the plaster on the wall.

sense.name: any device intentionally designed to be buoyant in water
sense.examples: We steered the boat clear of the floats on the lobster pots. That cushion serves as a float to be thrown to someone who has gone overboard. The plane has large floats to allow it to land on water.

sense.name: an air sac or swim bladder on a fish that adds buoyancy
sense.examples: That object in the water is the float of a Portuguese Man-of-War. This species of fish has floats along its spine.
